intro: Melanocenchris monoeca, commonly known as the single-flowered orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features a single, showy flower with a distinctive lip that is often darker in color than the rest of the flower. Its roots are fibrous and adapted for absorbing nutrients from the soil. Melanocenchris monoeca is noted for its specialized pollination mechanism, which involves specific insect species.
